body_html:
@jthestness FYI - we made derivative work based on your original https://github.com/baidu-research/tensorflow-allreduce called Horovod: https://github.com/uber/horovod. It's a plugin that installs on top of TensorFlow, so you can pip install tensorflow and then pip install horovod, no need to Bazel-build anything.

We made number of usability improvements and integrated NCCL 2 support, which makes it easier to use and it performs faster. We've also added special Horovod Timeline that aids debugging of overall distributed training. Now we're working on further optimisation techniques to gain further speed-up on networks with many tiny elements like resnet152 on large # of machines.

It's a plugin that installs on top of TensorFlow, so you can `pip install tensorflow` and then `pip install horovod`, no need to Bazel-build anything.

We made number of usability improvements and integrated NCCL 2 support, which makes it easier to use and it performs faster.  We've also added special Horovod Timeline that aids debugging of overall distributed training.  Now we're working on further optimisation techniques to gain further speed-up on networks with many tiny elements like `resnet152` on large # of machines.
